core.graph module¶

class core.graph.DoDAG(name, root, visualize=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Keep track of the dodag tree of the network.

This uses a networkx graph in the background and can dump it to file with graphviz package

detach_node(node_id)[source]¶

Detaches a node AND ALL ITS CHILDREN from the graph

WARNING THIS FUNCTION IS RECURSIVE this means that for very large graphs it will either crash or run until infinite time because python does not implement tail recursion optimization for more information see: http://neopythonic.blogspot.com.au/2009/04/tail-recursion-elimination.html http://neopythonic.blogspot.com.au/2009/04/final-words-on-tail-calls.html

Parameters:node_id –
Returns:
draw_graph(shape='circle', color='blue', penwidth=1, fullmac=False, graphname='graph.png')[source]¶

Saves a snapshot of the current dodag tree to a dot file and creates a png figure from that

Parameters:
  • shape – the shape of each node
  • color – color of the lines between the nodes
  • penwidth – width in pixels of the connecting lines
  • fullmac (bool) – wether the full mac address needs to be displayed or only the last four letters
  • graphname – the name of the dot and png file to be created

core.schedule module¶

class core.schedule.Reflector(net_name, lbr_ip, lbr_port, prefix, visualizer=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handle all the communication with the RICH network in a concurrent way.

Implements a callback-model to send operations to network nodes and trigger the appropriate callback upon replies. Maintains the proper sequence of messages to be sent to each node separately. For instance, it makes sure a cell is not POSTed at a node before that node has returned the id of the frame the cell belongs to; instead, the message is cached.

Every communication between the Reflector and a node in the network is split in sessions. Each session is independent from any other session and runs in parallel to others. That allows concurrent communication between the scheduler and any node. The parallel sessions the Reflector is engaged with, can be with the same or different nodes.

Each session defines a sequence of blocks of commands destined to various nodes. Commands in the same block can be transmitted simultaneously. All commands of a block need to have replied before the next block is executed. Users of Reflector should define those sessions with their blocks externally.

Besides the user-defined sessions, this class maintains the RPL DoDAG by installing a children observer to every node of the network.

The class provides a callback system for the following operations and resources:

  • GET & OBSERVE on RPL children of a node: the returned list of children is compared against current RPL DoDAG to determing (dis)connected nodes
  • POST a new slotframe: sets a frame of specific size (num. of slots) to a node. A callback is triggered upon received slotframe ID
  • GET, POST & DELETE a cell: installs/deletes a new cell to a node. A callback is triggered upon received cell ID.
  • GET, OBSERVE & POST a statistics resource: defines a new statistics resource with POST and can read its value with GET or OBSERVE. A call back is triggered upon receive resource ID or value.
  • GET, OBSERVE, POST & DELETE any user-defined resource
_DumpGraph()[source]¶

Saves the current dodag graph to file with as filename the timestamp of the current time

_TimeTick()[source]¶

This function is ran every second and decreases the value of the lost_children dictionary item with as key the mac address of the lost child. When this value is 0 the disconnection procedure of this node is started. Also _DumpGraph() is called to create a snapshot of the system after disconnection

Returns:None

_connect(child, parent, old_parent=None)[source]¶

is called when a new node connects, simply installes the observer for the dodaginfo resource. parent and old_parent are deprecated

_create_session(assembly)[source]¶

Creates and initiates a session given a BlockQueue. The session is registered to this object and all the commands of its first block are sent to their destinations.

Parameters:assembly (BlockQueue) – a stack of blocks of commands to be sent to the network nodes

Parameters:token (int) – the token/id of the command to be detected and removed
Returns:the command with the specified token
Return type:Command, or None if not found

_observe_dodag_info(response)[source]¶

callback for the dodaginfo observe resource. This resource consists off a 2 item list with at first position the parent and the second item the children list

Parameters:response (txthings.coap.Message) – the incomming data package
_observe_rpl_children(payload, parent_id)[source]¶

handles the parsing of received children list resource (part of the dodag resource). If a node is lost it is put on the lost child list, if a node has appeared the connection procedure is started.

Parameters:
  • payload (list) – the children list
  • parent_id (node.NodeID) – the id of the node which transmitted this child list
Raises:

UnsupportedCase
_observe_rpl_parent(payload, node_id)[source]¶

parses the respons of the parent resource (part of the dodaginfo resource). if the parent has changed, execute a rewiring procedure of this node to a new parent

Parameters:
  • payload (string) – the parent of the node
  • node_id (node.NodeID) – node which broadcasted this dodaginfo

  • session –
_receive_cell_id(response)[source]¶

Callback for cell resource. Triggered upon reception of a reply on the POST 6t/6/cl command. Records the cell identifier returned by the responder.

The responder returns the local ID generated by 6top once the new cell was installed with the POST 6t/6/cl command. The returned ID is recorded so that future requests with references to that cell e.g. GET 6t/6/cl/5 are possible.

Parameters:response (txthings.coap.Message) – the response returned by a node after a POST 6t/6/cl request
Raises:UnsupportedCase
_receive_deletion(response)[source]¶

Callback for deletion of cell

Parameters:response (txthings.coap.Message) – the response returned by a node
Raises:UnsupportedCase
_receive_probe(response)[source]¶

Callback for any other (i.e. not children, frame or cells) resource.

Triggered upon reception of a reply on POST, DELETE commands on i.e. 6t/6/sm etc. This can be coupled with _receive_report() function to implement a 2-way handshake. It supports POST 6t/6/sm for defining a statistics metrics resource (receive its id) and then use the returned id to GET/OBSERVE 6t/6/sm/0 its reported values via _receive_report() function. Extensible for any other command/resource but payload will passed to probed() uninterpreted in JSON format as a dictionary or list.

Parameters:response (txthings.coap.Message) – the response returned by a node after any request excluding GET rpl/c, POST 6t/6/sf, POST 6t/6/cl
Raises:UnsupportedCase
_receive_report(response)[source]¶

Callback for any other (i.e. not children, frame or cells) resource.

Though similar to _receive_probe(), the semantics are different. It is meant to be triggered by responses on GET/OBSERVE commands on i.e. 6t/6/sf or 6t/6/sm etc whereas _receive_probe() is meant more for POST/DELETE. It already supports GET/OBSERVE 6t/6/sm/<id> and 6t/6/cl/<id> for getting reports on the values of statistics metrics and contents of cells. :note: Currently GET/OBSERVE 6t/6/sm is not supported. However, GET/OBSERVE 6t/6/cl is.

Parameters:response (txthings.coap.Message) – the response returned by a node after any request excluding GET rpl/c, POST 6t/6/sf, POST 6t/6/cl
Raises:UnsupportedCase
_receive_slotframe_id(response)[source]¶

Callback for slotframe resource. Triggered upon reception of a reply on the POST 6t/6/sf command. Records the slotframe identifier returned by the responder.

The responder returns its local ID generated by 6top once the new frame was set with the POST 6t/6/sf command. As each node may return a different ID for the same slotframe, the returned ID is recorded so that future requests with references to that frame are possible.

Parameters:response (txthings.coap.Message) – the response returned by a node after a POST 6t/6/sf request
Raises:UnsupportedCase

_touch_session(achieved_comm, session_id)[source]¶

Remove a given command from a session. Send subsequent block of commands if the given command was the last pending command of the current block of the session.

Parameters:
  • achieved_comm (Command) – command that needs to be deleted from the session
  • session_id (int) – identifier of the session from which the commands needs to be deleted
